field_reports.summary: PAN: Biological Emergency - 06-2025 - Drinking Water Crisis in Herrera and Los Santos Provinces
field_reports.description:
As a result of activities such as intensive pig farming, use of agrochemicals, environmental and structural factors, due to which there has been a high level of microorganisms in the water intakes, which forced the suspension of water production at the Reinaldo Reyna plant, in Chitré, and Rufina Alfaro. in Los Santos from May 28, 2025 to date, these plants are supplied by the La Villa River.

SINAPROC in conjunction with the technical boards of the provinces in question have been activated to develop an operation to deliver water to the affected people, which so far are indicated to be approximately one hundred and nine thousand people (109,000), so far the operation has consisted of the distribution of bottled water.

So far, there are reports of affected communities in the districts of Chitré, Los Santos, Guararé, Macaracas and Las Tablas, with approximately 91 communities affected. In the province of Los Santos, until 10JUN25, a total of two hundred and forty thousand six hundred and four 117,045,665 gallons of bottled water in its different presentations (gallon, liter and 600 ml) have been distributed. In the province of  Herrera the population affected so far is estimated at more than sixty thousand, seven hundred and ninety-three (60,793) approximately, so far in the province of Herrera an approximate of one hundred and fifteen thousand six (115,006) gallons of bottled water have been distributed in different presentations (gallon, liters and 600 milliliters)

results.summary:
On June 7 and 8, 2025, the provinces of Herrera and Los Santos faced a serious crisis due to the contamination of their main water sources, such as the La Villa and Estibaná rivers. This situation affected more than 22,500 people, causing the suspension of the supply of drinking water and the temporary closure of several water treatment plants. Causes include dumping waste from pig farms, excessive use of agrochemicals, and poor management of solid waste. In response, the authorities implemented emergency measures such as the distribution of water in cisterns, the closure of polluting farms and the constant monitoring of water quality.

The authorities have implemented several emergency measures:

  • Distribution of bottled water and use of tanker trucks in affected communities.
  • Temporary closure of three pig farms responsible for dumping waste into rivers.
  • Constant monitoring of water quality by the Ministry of Health (MINSA) and the National Institute of Aqueducts and Sewers (IDAAN).
  • Special supply to hospitals such as Dr. Cecilio Castillero (Chitré), Anita Moreno (Los Santos), and other health centers
results.name: PAN: Biological Emergency - 06-2025 - Drinking Water Crisis in the Provinces of Herrera and Los Santos

field_reports.description:
For more than a decade, the pension system of the Social Security Fund (CSS) has faced problems of financial sustainability. Technical reports warned that the state subsidy was not enough and that the solidarity system was at risk of collapse.

In 2022, the Single Dialogue Table was installed in Penonomé, after massive protests over the high cost of living. Although health and social security issues were discussed, no consensus was reached on the reform of the pension system, which left the issue pending.

The immediate trigger for the recent protests was the approval and sanction of Law 462, which reformed key articles of the Organic Law of the CSS. This law:

  • Introduces a mixed pension system
  • It allows the investment of funds in financial institutions
  • It opens the door to a future revision of the retirement age

In addition to the law, the protesters also reject:

  • A security agreement signed with the U.S.
  • The lack of citizen consultation in the approval of the law
  • The perception that social security is being privatized

The protests began on April 23, 2025, led by the union of public sector teachers, in rejection of Law 462, which reforms the CSS pension system, which has been maintained peacefully. Other sectors have joined this mobilization, such as:

  • The Suntracs construction union
  • Pharmacists
  • Education Supervisors
  • Medical
  • Indigenous communities, especially of the Ngäbe Buglé ethnic group 

The demonstrators argue that the law compromises social security and the pension system, and also reject a security agreement signed between Panama and the United States.

Since Monday, May 12, road blockades have worsened , especially in the province of Bocas del Toro, where the strike has paralyzed banana production. The company Chiquita Panama announced the definitive suspension of production in an entire farm and additional areas, due to accumulated losses that exceed 10 million dollars; today, May 13, 2025 , clashes were reported between demonstrators and the National Police in the Ojo de Agua sector , province of Veraguas, where the Inter-American Highway, a key artery of the country, was blocked. At least 12 people were arrested, mostly Ngäbe Bugle Indians. Other places have been affected and there have been constant incidents between demonstrators  and police, such as in the province of Los Santos (Las Tablas and Puente del Río La Villa), Veraguas (Santiago) and Panama City.

The Ministry of Education announced that striking teachers will not receive their salaries, as a measure of pressure to resume work 

Impact

  • The protests have led to significant economic losses, especially in the agricultural sector.
  • The situation has escalated in tension, with growing mobilizations and a broad rejection of the reform by various unions and communities.

Since Monday, May 12, road blockades have worsened , especially in the province of Bocas del Toro, where the strike has paralyzed banana production. contacts.name: Daniel González
contacts.title: Jefe Nacional de Gestión de Riesgos

field_reports.description:
The National Department of Epidemiology of the Ministry of Health (Minsa), this Tuesday, January 28, an outbreak of oropouche fever after the analysis of samples collected at the health center of Metetí, in the province of Darién, confirmed 34 cases.

The authorities of the Ministry of Health, through Resolution 0098 of January 31, 2025, orders the Regional Health Directorate of Darién to coordinate the actions that are necessary to monitor, contain and implement the preparations for the response to the Oropouche outbreak.

Oropouche fever has resurfaced in Panama after more than 30 years since it was last detected. In November 2024, the first case was detected in a 31-year-old man. Although it was not considered a cause for alarm, authorities and health experts warned about the risks associated with the virus, especially in pregnant women, as it could be linked to fetal death and the development of congenital anomalies.

Oropouche fever is a febrile infection caused by the bite of Culicoides and Culex mosquitoes (known as "gnats").

The head of Epidemiology of the Minsa, Blas Armién, explained that of a total of 58 samples evaluated by a research team from the Gorgas Memorial Institute of Health Studies through polymerase chain reaction tests, 34 cases were positive.

He added that the temporal distribution of cases corresponds to December 2024 to January 15, 2025. The detection of positive cases suggests that the outbreak of oropouche continues actively in the affected area.

The age group between 40 and 49 years old is the most affected with an attack rate of 87.5%.

results.summary:
The National Department of Epidemiology of the Ministry of Health (Minsa), this Tuesday, January 28, an outbreak of oropouche fever after the analysis of samples collected at the health center of Metetí, in the province of Darién, confirmed 34 cases.

The authorities of the Ministry of Health, through Resolution 0098 of January 31, 2025, orders the Regional Health Directorate of Darién to coordinate the actions that are necessary to monitor, contain and implement the preparations for the response to the Oropouche outbreak.

Oropouche fever has resurfaced in Panama after more than 30 years since it was last detected. In November 2024, the first case was detected in a 31-year-old man. Although it was not considered a cause for alarm, authorities and health experts warned about the risks associated with the virus, especially in pregnant women, as it could be linked to fetal death and the development of congenital anomalies.

Oropouche fever is a febrile infection caused by the bite of Culicoides and Culex mosquitoes (known as "gnats").

The head of Epidemiology of the Minsa, Blas Armién, explained that of a total of 58 samples evaluated by a research team from the Gorgas Memorial Institute of Health Studies through polymerase chain reaction tests, 34 cases were positive.

He added that the temporal distribution of cases corresponds to December 2024 to January 15, 2025. The detection of positive cases suggests that the outbreak of oropouche continues actively in the affected area.

The age group between 40 and 49 years old is the most affected with an attack rate of 87.5%.

field_reports.description:
The National Civil Protection System (Sinaproc) informs the population that, in the face of a period of greater atmospheric instability over our region, a Yellow Alert is declared throughout the Panamanian territory, as of 6:00 p.m. this Thursday, October 31, 2024.

This preventive measure is due to a report on the weather conditions forecast by the Institute of Meteorology and Hydrology of Panama (IMHPA), which refers to the interaction of several atmospheric systems and the monitoring of a low pressure system in the Caribbean Basin with a potential cyclonic development of 50%, for the next 7 days.

From Friday, November 1 to November 5, 2024, persistent rains of varying intensity, electrical activity and gusts of wind are expected, indicates the IMHPA.

The Emergency Operations Center in view of this declaration reinforces its surveillance and monitoring throughout the national territory.

During today, November 2, river overflows have been recorded in the provinces of Chiriquí, Veraguas, Los Santos, Darién, Comarca Ngabe Bugle.

On the recommendation of the local authorities, the activities of the National Holidays scheduled for November 3 and 4 have been suspended in some provinces.

At the level of the Panamanian Red Cross, monitoring and surveillance is maintained by local committees, in some provinces the provincial coes have been activated. The National COE of SINAPROC has held a meeting with the institutional liaisons.

In the area of Sona, province of Veraguas, the search is underway for a member of the police who were affected by a landslide.

The National Civil Protection System (Sinaproc) declares a Red Alert in the provinces of Chiriquí, Bocas del Toro, Veraguas, Herrera, Los Santos and the Ngäbe Buglé region, as of 11:00 p.m., this Saturday, November 2, 2024. The rest of the country remains on Yellow Alert.

With the aim of preserving the supreme good that is the life of the population, this declaration is based on the risks that could be generated due to the rainfall and the already reported floods recorded during the last 24 hours over a large part of the Panamanian territory.

The technical scientific criteria of the Institute of Meteorology and Hydrology of Panama (IMHPA), refer to the interaction of several atmospheric systems and the Intertropical Convergence zone, which could generate significant accumulations of rainfall in the next few hours. "90% of Panamanian soil is saturated, keeping the provinces of Veraguas, Herrera, Los Santos and the Ngabe Buglé region the greatest saturation of soils," says the IMHPA.
Additionally, it is reported that as a result of the displacement of these atmospheric systems, the provinces of Chiriquí and Bocas del Toro will also receive significant rainfall.

SINAPROC warns to take precautions against floods, falling trees, landslides in vulnerable areas, flooding of rivers and streams.

In the last few hours, 35 situation reports have been received at the national level, which are broken down as follows

From Friday, November 1 to November 5, 2024, persistent rains of varying intensity, electrical activity and gusts of wind are expected, indicates the IMHPA.

The Emergency Operations Center in view of this declaration reinforces its surveillance and monitoring throughout the national territory.

During today, November 2, river overflows have been recorded in the provinces of Chiriquí, Veraguas, Los Santos, Darién, Comarca Ngabe Bugle.

On the recommendation of the local authorities, the activities of the National Holidays scheduled for November 3 and 4 have been suspended in some provinces.

contacts.name: Daniel González
contacts.title: Jefe Nacional de Gestión de Riesgos

field_reports.description:
The National Civil Protection System (SINAPROC) in view of the intensification of rains and the saturation of the soils, issues a declaration of Yellow Alert in the provinces of Chiriquí, Bocas del Toro, Veraguas, Herrera, Los Santos and the Ngäbe Buglé region, as of Monday, September 30. from 11:00 p.m. The rest of the country and the regions of the Panamanian territory are raised to Green Alert, as a preventive measure against the rains in a considerable way. 

This measure obeys the technical-scientific criteria of the Institute of Meteorology and Hydrology of Panama (IMHPA), which refers to a low pressure system over the Panamanian Caribbean, north of the country and due to cyclonic development (10% in 48 hours and 40% in 7 days). which could induce the incursion of significant wind flows and rainfall. 

According to the IMHPA, accumulated rainfall is forecast in the next 48 hours, between 50-70 mm in the western region, Veraguas and Azuero. The Emergency Operations Center (COE) is constantly monitoring atmospheric conditions and collaborating with local authorities to provide support if needed.

To guarantee the safety of citizens during this period of climate instability, SINAPROC recommends:
   • Stay informed through official sources.
   • During this declaration it is preferable not to visit trails, mountains, rivers, streams and lakes.
   • Do not park vehicles, or camp in dry riverbeds, or on the banks of rivers, to avoid being surprised by a sudden flood of water.
   • The population, especially those living in risk areas, is recommended to stay informed and comply with the prevention measures of emergency institutions and security forces.

The population is urged to follow these recommendations to minimize risks and ensure their safety.

field_reports.epi_notes_since_last_fr:
Hasta la semana epidemiológica N.29, se han acumulado un total de 8,774 casos confirmados, registrando un total de 20 defunciones a nivel nacional.

La región de Panamá Metro registra la mayor cantidad de casos con 2,228, seguido de Colón con 1,324 y Panamá Oeste con 927.

Entre los corregimientos con mayor incidencia de casos tenemos: Las Garzas con 868 casos, y 24 de Diciembre con 317 en Panamá Metro; Pacora con 242 casos, Chepo con 199 casos en Panamá Este; Cativá y Cristóbal, 214 casos y 205 casos, respectivamente en Colón; y en la región de Panamá Oeste, los corregimientos de Burunga con 169 casos y Arraiján con 160.
field_reports.description:
Through resolution No. 1580, the General Directorate of Public Health has decreed that the health alert will be focused on the townships with the highest incidences of cases, which are: in Panama Metro, Las Garzas, 24 de Diciembre; in Panama Este, Pacora, Chepo; in Colón, Cristóbal, Cativá, Cristóbal Este; and West Panama in Burunga and Arraiján.

In these regions, plans to combat the Aedes aegypti mosquito, which transmits dengue, will be reinforced through the search, elimination and control of breeding sites, with activities such as space nebulization by thermo nebulization and ultra-low volume (heavy) spatial nebulization.

At the regional level, according to data provided by the Pan American Health Organization (PAHO), nearly 10 million cases of dengue have been detected, increasing by 232% percent, compared to 2023, and Panama does not escape the high rates of positive cases.

People between 10 and 34 years old are the age range with the highest number of cases, which can affect both education and work with absences due to disability.

There are 67 hospitalizations due to dengue and there are no patients in intensive care

results.summary:
Through resolution No. 1580, the General Directorate of Public Health has decreed that the health alert will be focused on the townships with the highest incidences of cases, which are: in Panama Metro, Las Garzas, 24 de Diciembre; in Panama Este, Pacora, Chepo; in Colón, Cristóbal, Cativá, Cristóbal Este; and West Panama in Burunga and Arraiján.

In these regions, plans to combat the Aedes aegypti mosquito, which transmits dengue, will be reinforced through the search, elimination and control of breeding sites, with activities such as space nebulization by thermo nebulization and ultra-low volume (heavy) spatial nebulization.

At the regional level, according to data provided by the Pan American Health Organization (PAHO), nearly 10 million cases of dengue have been detected, increasing by 232% percent, compared to 2023, and Panama does not escape the high rates of positive cases.

People between 10 and 34 years old are the age range with the highest number of cases, which can affect both education and work with absences due to disability.

There are 67 hospitalizations due to dengue and there are no patients in intensive care
results.name: PAN: Epidemic - 08-2024 - dengue

field_reports.description:
BERYL is moving quickly and entered the Southeast and Central Caribbean Sea during the night of July  2 and is forecast to pass over Jamaica or very close to this island, this Wednesday, July 3. Transverse winds from the west will likely exert shear effects on its conglomerate of convective cells and could weaken it. Another factor that could contribute to its weakening is its interaction with the mainland when it makes contact with Jamaica. However, even though the minimum central pressure of this cyclonic system could increase slightly and its sustained winds could decrease in intensity, BERYL would continue to be a highly destructive hurricane. As for the territory of Panama, although the center of BERYL will be, along its trajectory, at a relatively large distance from Panama, its cloud bands (spiral arms) together with its rotation in a counter-clockwise direction could exert a suction effect of the humidity of the Pacific displacing it towards the Pacific coast of our country. In its path through the Caribbean basin, the maximum approach of BERYL to Panama, taking the city of Colón as a reference, will be approximately 1015 km. As you can see, this cyclonic system will pass quite far from our territory. 

The National Civil Protection System (SINAPROC) reports that a watch warning is maintained for conditions of a storm surge (waves generated by a tropical cyclone) in the Caribbean Sea, from July 03 to 04 , 2024.

Areas under notice:
Eastern Caribbean: Costa Arriba de Colón and Guna Yala region with waves between 0.9-1.8 meters high and periods 8.0-12.0 seconds.

Central Caribbean: Costa Abajo de Colón and Veraguas Norte with waves between 0-9 to 1.5 meters high and periods of 8.0 to 11.0 seconds.

Western Caribbean: Ngäbe-Buglé and Bocas del Toro Region with waves from 1.0 to 2.0 meters high and periods from 8.0 to 13.0 seconds.

The Institute of Meteorology and Hydrology of Panama (IMHPA) reports that the displacement of Hurricane BERYL in the Caribbean Sea basin will be generating significant maritime conditions on the coasts of the Panamanian Caribbean, causing a precautionary scenario.

Since the night of yesterday, July 2, there have been intermittent rains in various sectors of the country.

results.summary:
BERYL is moving quickly and will enter the Southeast and Central Caribbean Sea overnight and is forecast to pass over Jamaica or very close to this island, this Wednesday, July 3. Transverse winds from the west will likely exert shear effects on its conglomerate of convective cells and could weaken it. Another factor that could contribute to its weakening is its interaction with the mainland when it makes contact with Jamaica. However, even though the minimum central pressure of this cyclonic system could increase slightly and its sustained winds could decrease in intensity, BERYL would continue to be a highly destructive hurricane. As for the territory of Panama, although the center of BERYL will be, along its trajectory, at a relatively large distance from Panama, its cloud bands (spiral arms) together with its rotation in a counter-clockwise direction could exert a suction effect of the humidity of the Pacific displacing it towards the Pacific coast of our country. In its path through the Caribbean basin, the maximum approach of BERYL to Panama, taking the city of Colón as a reference, will be approximately 1015 km. As you can see, this cyclonic system will pass quite far from our territory. 

The National Civil Protection System (SINAPROC) reports that a watch warning is maintained for conditions of a storm surge (waves generated by a tropical cyclone) in the Caribbean Sea, from July 03 to 04 , 2024.

Areas under notice:
Eastern Caribbean: Costa Arriba de Colón and Guna Yala region with waves between 0.9-1.8 meters high and periods 8.0-12.0 seconds.

Central Caribbean: Costa Abajo de Colón and Veraguas Norte with waves between 0-9 to 1.5 meters high and periods of 8.0 to 11.0 seconds.

Western Caribbean: Ngäbe-Buglé and Bocas del Toro Region with waves from 1.0 to 2.0 meters high and periods from 8.0 to 13.0 seconds.

The Institute of Meteorology and Hydrology of Panama (IMHPA) reports that the displacement of Hurricane BERYL in the Caribbean Sea basin will be generating significant maritime conditions on the coasts of the Panamanian Caribbean, causing a precautionary scenario.

Since the night of yesterday, July 2, there have been intermittent rains in various sectors of the country.
results.name: PAN: Cyclone - 07-2024 - Cyclone Beryl

field_reports.description: The rejection of the mining contract by a sector of the Panamanian population has provoked demonstrations, protests and closures throughout the territory, provoking tension and clashes between groups opposed to the contract and the forces of public order. The demonstrations took place late into the night in areas where there was a confrontation with firearms, resulting in the death of two demonstrators and the wounding of two police officers. Other closures that remain indefinite in the sector of Santiago de Veraguas and Horconcito cruce de Soloy in the Ngabe Bugle region. Yesterday, 71 closure points were recorded nationwide, affecting hundreds of people who attended who were unable to move to their work areas, attend medical appointments or other assignments. Schools have closed classes, today closures have been reported in different areas. On October 26, 2023, the scene of various demonstrations, marches and protests have intensified throughout the country, different unions and also groups join the confrontation. The protests have led to clashes between demonstrators and the security forces; This has led to incidents of violence, the use of tear gas and rubber bullets by the security forces. So far, the government has not issued statements for dialogue spaces. The protests continue to intensify, producing uncertainty in the population. In total, there are 91 closure points throughout the territory

results.summary: The rejection of the mining contract by a sector of the Panamanian population has provoked demonstrations, protests and closures throughout the territory, causing tension and clashes between groups opposed to the contract and the forces of public order. The demonstrations took place late into the night in areas where there was a confrontation with firearms, resulting in the death of two demonstrators and the wounding of two police officers. Other closures remain indefinite in the sector of Santiago de Veraguas and Horconcito, crossing of Soloy, in the Ngabe Bugle region. Yesterday, 71 closure points were recorded nationwide, affecting hundreds of people who attended who were unable to move to their work areas, attend medical appointments or other assignments. Schools have closed classes, today closures have been reported in different areas
results.name: PAN: Other - 2023-10 - Protests and Demonstrations

field_reports.description:
SINAPROC declares a green alert (preventive) in the provinces of Panama, Coclé, Colón, Los Santos, Chiriquí, Panamá Oeste, Veraguas, Darien and in the regions of Ngäbe Bugle and Guna Yala, due to the instability of the climate, associated with the monitoring of Tropical Storm Franklin.

According to the Institute of Meteorology and Hydrology of Panama (IMHPA), significant amounts of rainfall are expected during the next 24 hours for Colón, Panamá Oeste, Chiriquí, Veraguas, Los Santos, Comarca Ngäbe Buble, Guna Yala and Coclé. The Green Alert will be maintained until Thursday, August 24, 2023 and it is given as a preventive warning for monitoring and surveillance of possible threat that may affect the community, region or country. The National Civil Protection System recommends to the Mayors, Governors, Local Authorities, Representatives of the Institutions of the Emergency Operations Center to remain in a ready state, with a monitoring team to prevent emergency situations.

results.summary:
SINAPROC declares a green alert (preventive) in the provinces of Panama, Coclé, Colón, Los Santos, Chiriquí, Panamá Oeste, Veraguas, Darien and in the regions of Ngäbe Bugle and Guna Yala, due to the instability of the climate, associated with the monitoring of Tropical Storm Franklin.

According to the Institute of Meteorology and Hydrology of Panama (IMHPA), significant amounts of rainfall are expected during the next 24 hours for Colón, Panamá Oeste, Chiriquí, Veraguas, Los Santos, Comarca Ngäbe Buble, Guna Yala and Coclé. The Green Alert will be maintained until Thursday, August 24, 2023 and it is given as a preventive warning for monitoring and surveillance of possible threat that may affect the community, region or country. The National Civil Protection System recommends to the Mayors, Governors, Local Authorities, Representatives of the Institutions of the Emergency Operations Center to remain in a ready state, with a monitoring team to prevent emergency situations.
results.name: PAN: Flood - 2023-08 - Panama Floods

field_reports.description: El día 4 de noviembre el Sistema Nacional de Protección Declara Alerte Verde en 9 provincias (Chiriquí, Veraguas, Los Santos, Herrera, Coclé, Panamá Oeste, Panamá y Darien) debido a un sistema de baja presión y la zona de convergencia intertropical, ubicada al Norte del país, la cual podría generar deslizamientos de tierras y el desbordamientos de ríos y quebradas. El día 9 de noviembre, debido a las fuertes lluvias, que se registran en las Provincias de Herrera, Veraguas y los Santos, provocando el desbordamiento de los principales ríos de estas provincias, al momento hay sectores que no han podido ser evaluados por la crecida de los ríos, el Sistema Nacional de Protección Civil a elevado la alerta a Amarilla en las provincias afectadas por las fuertes lluvias

results.summary: On November 4, the National Protection System declared a Green Alert in 9 provinces (Chiriquí, Veraguas, Los Santos, Herrera, Coclé, Panama Oeste, Panamá and Darien) due to a low pressure system and the intertropical convergence zone, located in the north of the country. which could generate landslides and the overflowing of rivers and streams. On November 9, due to the heavy rains, which are recorded in the Provinces of Herrera, Veraguas and Los Santos, causing the overflow of the main rivers of these provinces, at the moment there are sectors that have not been able to be evaluated due to the flooding of the rivers, the National Civil Protection System has raised the alert to Yellow in the provinces affected by the strong Rains
results.name: PAN: Flood - 2022-11 - Floods

results.summary: At 11:00 hrs (UTC –5:00) on October 06, 2022, the Hydrometeorology Directorate of the Electric Transmission Company (ETESA) of Panama, issued a Warning for Tropical Depression #13, due to the potential for cyclone formation, currently with sustained winds max. of 56 Km/h. • Its movement towards the north of the Caribbean coasts of Panama is forecast. • According to monitoring models, important rainy events with high potential to generate floods and/or landslides are expected over the country starting on Friday, October 7, due to the high volume of accumulated daily rainfall. • Rainfall accumulation in mountainous areas is forecast to exceed 100mm per day, which can cause sudden floods in rivers and tributaries threatening life and infrastructure. • The National Civil Protection System (SINAPROC) has issued a declaration of GREEN ALERT throughout the national territory due to the forecasts of rainy events, which will coincide with high tides, which can reach up to 17.5 feet in height, between October 8 and 13. • The population has been urged not to go to trails, rivers, streams, lakes and beaches during the declaration of the alert. • The system is also being monitored by NOAA, forecasting heavy rains and flash flooding and landslides in Central America this weekend, as the system progresses under watch.
results.name: PAN: Pluvial Flood/Flood - 2022-10 - Rainy Events and Potential Cyclone Formation (Depression #13)

contacts.name: Gerardo Escalante Hernandez
contacts.title: Disaster Management Coordinator - Central America Cluster Delegation

field_reports.summary: PAN: Ciclón - 2022-10 - Tormenta Tropical Julia - Reporte final #1 (2022-10-10)
field_reports.description:
• El Sistema Nacional de Protección Civil (Sinaproc)  informa que a partir de las 6:00 de la mañana de este lunes, 10 de octubre de 2022, se levanta la Alerta Amarilla decretada a nivel nacional.
  • Se mantiene el nivel de alerta AMARILLA solo para Chiriqui y Bocas del Toro, debido a las lluvias de la temporada, resto del pais en alerta VERDE y para la provincia de Panama, se levanta totalmente la alerta.
  • Según los reportes de Hidrometeorología, la República de Panamá se encuentra fuera de los efectos indirectos de la tormenta Julia, y la tendencia de las condiciones meteorologicas es a mejorar en las proximas horas.

results.summary:
• At 11:00 hrs (UTC –5:00) on October 06, 2022, the Hydrometeorology Directorate of the Electric Transmission Company (ETESA) of Panama, issued a Watch Warning for Tropical Depression #13, due to the potential for cyclone formation, with the declaration of a GREEN ALERT for the entire country.
  • At 10:00 a.m. (UTC –5:00) on October 7, Tropical Storm Julia is declared, and the National Civil Protection System issues a YELLOW ALERT declaration for 8 provinces and 2 regions.
  • In the afternoon of Friday, October 7, multiple areas of the province of Colón were reported to have been affected by flooding. The sectors reported at the moment include the Colon Free Zone, Amador Guerrero Avenue on 4th and 5th streets, Villas del Caribe, San Judas, Las Mercedes Costa Arriba, La Verbena, 4 Altos, Villa Los Angeles, the latter sector where a landslide is reported that affects a residence leaving three (3) people buried.
  • Panamanian Red Cross volunteers and Joint Task Force personnel manage to rescue one of the victims alive, while another person is pronounced dead at the scene. The third victim was helped by the neighbors of the community, but had not yet been located.
  • Julia is forecast to strengthen into a hurricane through Saturday, Oct. 8. Life-threatening flash floods and landslides are expected due to the high volume of accumulated daily rainfall.
results.name: PAN: Cyclone - 2022-10 - Tropical Storm Julia

field_reports.affected_pop_centres: Chiriquí, Santiago, Panamá (área metropolitana), Panamá Este, Darién.
field_reports.summary: PAN: Civil Unrest - 2022-07 - Disturbios civiles y protestas. Reporte #6 (2022-07-20)
field_reports.description: Los bloqueos en la vía internacional Interamericana se mantienen. • Escasea el combustible y mucho de la producción alimenticia del país se esta perdiendo en los puntos de cosecha o en los camiones de carga varados en los bloqueos, por lo que productores han solicitado al Gobierno la implementación de un "corredor humanitario" para el transporte de alimentos, combustible e insumos. • Medios de prensa escritos han informado que se estiman unas 7,500 familias (aprox. 37,500 personas) que potencialmente se verían afectadas en los sectores de Santa Fe y Torti en Darien, por la suspensión de plantas de generación eléctrica. • En algunos puntos se observa una racionalización de productos por cliente al momento de la compra, debido a la escasez. • Los pueblos originarios de la comarca Ngäbe Bugle se han reiterado en paro nacional y convocan a mas jornadas de protesta y bloqueo de calles. • Durante todo el día se dieron demostraciones y protestas en múltiples puntos tanto del área metropolitana y sector este de la ciudad. • En la tarde y noche del 20/julio se han dado fuertes enfrentamientos entre las unidades de control de multitudes de la Policía Nacional y grupos manifestantes en el área de Santiago, provincia de Veraguas. Fuentes gubernamentales informan de siete (7) personas detenidas. • En noticieros y redes sociales se observan múltiples personas heridas y/o afectadas por la acción policial de desalojar a los manifestantes, incluyendo bebés y adultos mayores que no participaban de las demostraciones/manifestaciones, así como manifestantes e incluso unidades de la Policía Nacional. Los enfrentamientos duraron mas de 3 horas. Se dieron acciones de vandalismo, incluyendo la destrucción de un vehículo policial • Las personas en condición de movilidad que llegan a las Estaciones de Recepción Migratoria (ERM) de Darién se han mantenido igualmente represadas al ser imposible la movilización por carretera, generando igualmente tensión entre esta población al verse demorado su paso hacia la ERM de Gualaca en la provincia de Chiriquí. Dentro de estos grupos particularmente vulnerables, se contabilizan 1,500 personas migrantes que estarían siendo movilizadas en la madrugada del 20/julio en buses por parte del gobierno y que posiblemente demoren un aproximado de 32 horas en llegar a la ERM de Gualaca por los bloqueos de carretera • A pesar de los múltiples bloqueos y comunidades potencialmente afectadas, no se cuenta actualmente con una cifra estimada u oficial.

field_reports.summary: PAN: Civil Unrest - 2022-07 - Disturbios civiles y protestas. Reporte  #5 (2022-07-18)
field_reports.description: Un grupo de dirigentes, de algunos gremios en protesta en el pais, habrian llegado a un acuerdo con el gobierno panameño para levantar las medidas, sin embargo en la tarde del 17/julio se generaron nuevamente los bloqueos en la Carretera Interamericana a nivel de la provincia de Chiriquí y Veraguas debido al descontento de las bases de estos gremios indicando que no habia concenso. • Los bloqueos en otras partes del pais tampoco fueron levantados y se mantiene la situacion de riesgo de salud de las personas que no pudieron salir a tiempo de los bloqueos. • En cuanto a seguridad alimentaria, se siguen recibiendo reportes de mercados con escasez dado que los pocos vehiculos de carga con productos alimenticios que han logrado pasar, llegan con productos casi a término o en mal estado. Igual situacion se registra en el suministro de combustible, sobre todo en el area de Chiriquí. • El Sindicato Unico de Trabajadores de la Industria de la Construccion y Afines (SUNTRAC) ha decretado una paralizacion de labores con efecto a partir del 18/julio. • Debido a esto se han sumado muchos mas puntos de cierre de avenidas y calles en el area metropolitana, incluyendo los Corredores (autopistas) Norte y Sur.

field_reports.summary: PAN: Civil Unrest - 2022-07 - Disturbios civiles y protestas. Reporte #4 (2022-07-17)
field_reports.description: Al cierre de la jornada del 16/julio aun se mantienen bloqueos en la carretera Panamericana, en la provincia de Chiriquí: San Félix, área del Salado, Cerro Iglesia, cruce de Horconcitos, San Juan, cruce de Tolé, cruce de Viguí, Jacú, Rio Piedra; y en la provincia de Veraguas: puente vehicular, Las Palmas de Ojo de Agua, entrada a Atalaya, a lo cual se han sumado cierres adicionales en el área de Isla Bocas (lanchas completamente detenidas para entrar/salir de la isla) así como en el área de Tortí (Darién) afectando tambien el transporte de personas migrantes que coordina el Servicio Nacional de Migracion para asegurar el flujo de personas entre las Estaciones de Recepcion Migratoria de San Vicente hacia Gualaca en Chiriqui. • Los bloqueos se ha abierto por breves espacios de tiempo para permitir el paso, pero aun se mantienen muchas personas varadas en la carretera sin acceso constante a hidratación, alimento e higiene personal. • Las protestas y demostraciones se han mantenido en una tónica sin violencia, a pesar que aun se dan algunos focos de crimen común, principalmente en horas de la noche. • Se registra desabastecimiento de combustible en la provincia de Chiriquí (Barú, Boquete, David), así como la escasez de algunos alimentos a pesar que se han podido movilizar entre la noche del 15/julio y la madrugada del 16/julio camiones de carga y productos alimenticios. • El Gobierno panameño ha instalado mesas de diálogo, pero los grupos de protesta no han cedido en sus exigencias y se ha convocado a una paralización nacional para el próximo lunes 18/julio, si no se llega a un acuerdo total de todos los puntos en discusión. •

contacts.name: Renaldo Bedoya
contacts.title: 1er VIcepresidente Nacional / Punto Focal Rapid Response,

field_reports.summary: PAN: Civil Unrest - 2022-07 - Disturbios civiles y protestas. Reporte  #3 (2022-07-14)
field_reports.description: Las demostraciones y protestas de la sociedad civil y gremios se siguen registrando en practicamente todo el pais. Al cierre de la jornada del 13/julio se registraron actos de vandalismo en diversos puntos del area metropolitana de ciudad de Panama, Corredor vehicular Norte (autopista) y en la Plaza 5 de mayo (cercano al Palacio Legislativo), asi como enfrentamientos aislados de manifestantes con unidades policiales. • Los bloqueos en la carretera panamericana se mantienen en diversos sectores, manteniendo represadas a miles de personas en la carretera sin acceso a hidratacion o alimento. • Entre los grupos que se estan manifestando se genero rumor que las ambulancias de las diferentes entidades de emergencia estaban transportando unidades de la policia, por lo que en el area de La Villa de Los Santos se produjeron incidentes menores, en los cuales se vio tambien afectada una unidad de socorro de Cruz Roja Panameña al ser detenida a demanda de los manifestantes para ser revisada y que tuvieran la certeza que no se transportaba personal ajeno al Movimiento. • Se reporta por varios medios de comunicacion un inminente desabastecimiento de alimentos en diversos mercados privados y municipales por la afectacion de movilidad. • En horas de la noche se dieron focos de delicuencia comun al margen de las protestas y cierres de calles. • El Estado panameño ha realizado una convocatoria a mesa de dialogo en Ciudad del Saber en la ciudad de Panama (Clayton), sin embargo algunos gremios han rechazado este llamado indicando que deben enviarse representantes del gobierno al area de Veraguas. • Para las 15hrs de hoy 14/julio se prevee una amplia concentracion de personas en respaldo a la postura de los gremios en la mesa de dialogo convocada. • Vias de acceso en el area metropolitana pueden verse comprometidas por posibles marchas de estos gremios.

contacts.name: Renaldo Bedoya
contacts.title: 1er VIcepresidente Nacional / Punto Focal Rapid Response

field_reports.summary: PAN: Civil Unrest - 2022-07 - Disturbios civiles y protestas. Reporte #2 (2022-07-12)
field_reports.description: En funcion de las demostraciones y protestas de la sociedad civil y gremios que se han registrado en el pais, el Presidente Nacional de la Republica ha enviado un mensaje al pais en la tarde del 11/julio, donde se anuncian medidas de control de precios que entrarian en vigencia a partir del 15/julio. • El Sindicato Único Nacional de Trabajadores de la Industria de la Construcción y Similares (SUNTRACS) ha rechazado el anuncio de las medidas y ha indicado que se mantiene la convocatoria a una gran marcha nacional para el 12/julio y huelga en todo el pais a partir del 13/julio. La Coordinadora Nacional de Pueblos Indígenas de Panamá (COONAPIP) habria anunciado tambien su respaldo a la medida previamente. • Los buses que transportaban personas migrantes desde las ERM de Darien hacia la ERM de Gualaca en Chiriqui, se les permitió el paso en los bloqueos de carretera que aun mantienen grupos de pueblos originarios en San Felix, Tole y Horconcitos.

contacts.name: Renaldo Bedoya
contacts.title: 1er VIcepresidente Nacional / Punto Focal Rapid Response

field_reports.summary: PAN: Civil Unrest - 2022-07 - Disturbios civiles y protestas
field_reports.description:
Panamá vive intensas protestas por parte de productores, educadores, indígenas, estudiantes universitarios, transportistas y varios gremios. Por medio de sus protestas piden una solución inmediata al gobierno sobre el alto costo de la canasta básica familiar:
Desde el lunes 27 de junio de 2022 se generó la paralización de labores de transporte de carga agrícola (vegetales, verduras, frutas y productos cárnicos) hacia el país por parte de productores de Tierras Altas, cerrando completamente la Via Interamericana en la provincia de Chiriqui • Desde tempranas horas del martes 5 de julio de 2022, miembros de diversos gremios docentes se manifestaron en varios puntos del país para exigir al Gobierno tome medidas urgentes en contra del alza de precios de los combustibles y el elevado costo de la vida en Panamá.¨ La Asociación de Educadores Veragüenses  (AEVE), uno de las organizaciones magisteriales en paro denunciaron que dicha alza genera un efecto dominó sobre otras áreas como la canasta básica, el uso del transporte público, el costo de los medicamentos, y una serie de vulnerabilidades en materia de derechos humanos. . Las manifestaciones de los docentes coinciden con otras que reclaman se atienda el alto costo de la vida y el combustible. Uno de estos fueron los miembros del Sindicato Único Nacional de Trabajadores de la Industria de la Construcción y Similares (SUNTRACS) que igual se manifestaron en distintos puntos de la geografía nacional. También la Asociación de Médicos, Odontólogos y Afines de la Caja de Seguro Social dio plazo de 48 horas al gobierno para que tome medidas inmediatas de ahorro fiscal. De lo contrario entrarán en huelga nacional de brazos caídos por 48 horas prorrogables. • Desde el lunes 11 de julio de 2022, diversos sectores como los educadores y transportistas, además de constructores protagonizaron con sus bases cierres de vías y paralización de labores de 48 horas de advertencia.  Hay siete (7) buses con migrantes, aproximadamente 150 personas de diversas nacionalidades, varados en el cierre en San Félix que son llevados a la Estación de Recepción de Migrantes en Gualaca, y se han registrados fuertes discusiones entre los migrantes y los grupos protestantes. • Para el martes 12 de julio se prevé una marcha de la alianza que en horas de la tarde partirá desde el parque Belisario Porras hasta la Asamblea Nacional (parlamento) para insistir en las demandas sociales. •

contacts.name: Marinson Buitrago Salinas
contacts.title: Gestor de Manejo de Desastres y Crisis

contacts.name: Marylin Bonfante
contacts.title: Directora Unidad desarrollo Social y Humanitario

field_reports.description: Existe una incertidumbre más alta de lo normal en el pronóstico del sistema, una vez alcance el suroeste del mar Caribe entre el jueves y el viernes, lo cual dependerá de cuanto interactúe el sistema con el área continental.

field_reports.gov_affected_pop_centres: Región Autónoma del Caribe Norte y Sur
field_reports.description: SE espera que el Ciclón tropical Bonnie impacte el Sábado 2 de julio del 2022, a las 8: am según modelos de pronósticos entre Bilwi y Bluefields, lo cual afectarías las dos regiones de la Costa Caribe. Se prevé que en su trayectoria se fortalezca en las costas del mar caribe e impacte con categoría 2 o 3 según escala Saffir Simpson. Exponiendo a una población de 1155998 personas,. con posibilidades de inundaciones y deslaves motivo por el cual se estaran activando 345 albergues y casas solidarias para ubicar a las familias en condiciones de vulnerabilidad.

On Monday June 27, 2022 at 4:30PM the National Emergency Advisory council (NEAC) convened a National stakeholders meeting, which Grenada Red Cross participated in. In that meeting the Grenada Meteorological office advised that as of 5PM on Monday there will be a bulletin release advising the public that Grenada is under tropical storm warning.

Subsequent to the meeting the GRCS began to mobilise its key volunteers and officers. On Tuesday morning a team was at the headquarters preparing the EOC for use, securing the building and checking emergency supplies and equipment.

As per the 2PM bulleting issued by the Grenada Meteorological Service Cloudy to overcast conditions with moderate to heavy scattered showers, thundershowers and gusty winds are expected from Tuesday afternoon into 
Wednesday morning. Model guidance is indicating total rainfall of 100 to 150 millimeters across 
the state of Grenada.

Potential Impacts:
- Flooding and Flash flooding 
- Landslides and rock fall
- Broken tree branches and displacement of loose objects
- Rough waves up to thirteen (13) feet

field_reports.summary: TTO: Cyclone - 2022-06 - Update 2 - Invest 94L upgraded to Potential Tropical Cyclone 2 #2 (2022-06-27)
field_reports.description: As of 5:30pm the Trinidad and Tobago Met Office has issued an Orange Level Alert and placed Trinidad and Tobago under Tropical Storm warning. Even through Potential Tropical Cyclone 2 has not yet been declared, we are still in anticipation of hazardous weather from the afternoon of 28/06/2022 which is likely to affect both islands of Trinidad and Tobago.

results.summary: After passing through the southern Caribbean and northern Venezuela and Colombia, tropical system number two - now Tropical Storm Bonnie - is in front of the Caribbean of Costa Rica and Nicaragua, where it will pass before reaching the Pacific Ocean. Red Cross Societies in the region have prepared communities to prevent loss of life and livelihoods. (IFRC ARO, Comms)
results.name: Tropical Storm Bonnie

field_reports.summary: Afectaciones por la Onda Tropical 19,20 y 21
field_reports.description: El Sistema Nacional de Protección Civil (SINAPROC) en la tarde de hoy declaró  Alerta Amarilla en la provincia de Bocas del Toro, debido al impacto de las inundaciones registradas en las últimas horas. No hay personas desaparecidas ni situaciones que lamentar; sin embargo, se han  realizado las evacuaciones de aproximadamente 293 personas hacia los albergue temporales en los distritos de Changuinola y Almirante. Para atender esta emergencia de manera coordinada con la Fuerza de Tarea Conjunta  se activó el Centro de Operaciones Provincial en la Policía Nacional de Changuinola. Según informes preliminares del Centro de Operaciones de Emergencia Nacional (COEN) hay casas que sufrieron afectaciones por la introducción de agua.  Por el momento  continúa  la evaluación de daños. El SINAPROC en horas de la mañana por el incremento y acumulados de lluvias declaró Alerta Verde Preventiva en las provincias de Chiriquí, Colón, Sur de Veraguas, Península de Azuero y comarca Ngäbe Buglé. Según los pronósticos de ETESA se prevé que para los días 24 y 25 de julio de 2021 habrá acumulado máximos de lluvias desde 40 y 80 milímetros o litros de agua por cada metro cuadrado en el territorio nacional.

field_reports.affected_pop_centres: Bajo Chiquito, La Peñita, Canan Menbrillo, Jaque, Meteti,, Canglon, Los Planes de Gualaca
field_reports.description:
El flujo migratorio en la frontera del Darién ha continuado creciendo de manera exponencial desde el periodo de julio a octubre 2021. El promedio de ingresos diarios es aproximadamente entre 700 a 1000 personas. 

De manera proporcional ven incrementadas su situación de extrema vulnerabilidad debido a las condiciones y situaciones vividas en el trayecto en la ruta y los posteriores procesos luego de su llegada a los Establecimientos de Recepción Migratoria (ERM).

Desde comienzo del 2021 a la fecha han atravesado la frontera 91,305 personas en contexto migratorio por la frontera Panama /Colombia, se reflejó el primer salto en el mes de junio y no ha parado de incrementarse hasta la actualidad. En el periodo de enero a junio 2021, el total de ingresos fue de 15.949 personas y de julio a setiembre 2021 de 75.446, estas cifras reflejan el incremento de un 400 % de personas que atraviesan la frontera en el tapo del Darién.

Las nacionalidades de las personas que llegan a los Establecimientos de Recepción migratoria corresponden a un 79% de las Antillas, 16% de América del sur, 3% África y 2% de Asia. Una gran presencia de personas haitianas, seguida por cubanas, chilenas, brasileñas, bangladesh y Senegal.

La selva del Darién presenta grandes desafíos y riesgos mortales para quien la cruza, crimen organizado y situación de violencia sexual como medida de persuasión a la continuidad en la ruta. De las personas que cruzan la frontera el 59% son hombres, el 41% son mujeres, el 79% son personas adultas y un 21% menores de edad.

field_reports.summary: Inundaciones Costa Arriba y Abajo - Provincia de Colon
field_reports.description: Durante la madrugada del día 10 de enero se registran fuertes lluvias de variada intensidad con tronadas ocasionales  y ráfagas de vientos afectando comunidades de Costa Arriba de Colon (maria chiquita, Portobelo, nuevo Tonosi, Cacique, Puerto Lindo,La guaira., Nombre de Dios, Santa Isabel, Palenque, Palmira, MIramar, Cuango y viento Frio) y Costa Abajo de Colon (Achiote, Piña, Chagres, Palmas Bellas, Salud, Rio Indio, Gobea, Miguel de la Borda, Guasimo y Coclesito) siendo una poblacion estimada de 10,181 habitantes, voluntarios del comite de Portobelo se encuentra junto al personal de SINAPROC realizando evacuaciones y evaluaciones de daños

results.name: Inundaciones Costa Arriba y Abajo - Provincia de Colon

field_reports.description: El Consejo de Gabinete extendió este domingo la declaración del estado de emergencia ambiental para las provincias de Colón, Darién, Los Santos, y las comarcas de Guna Yala, Madugandí, Emberá, Wouanaan y Wargandi, ante los posibles efectos colaterales del huracán Iota sobre el territorio nacional.En el Gabinete extraordinario realizado este domingo y encabezado por el presidente de la República, Laurentino Cortizo Cohen y el vicepresidente José Gabriel Carrizo, se aprobó modificar la Resolución de Gabinete NO.85 del 7 de noviembre de 2020, que declaró el Estado de Emergencia Ambiental en siete provincias (Bocas del Toro, Coclé, Chiriquí, Herrera, Panamá, Panamá Oeste, Veraguas y la Comarca Ngäbe Buglé) por los efectos indirectos que dejó el pasado huracán Eta.De esta manera se agrega la declaratoria del Estado de Emergencia Ambiental, por el paso del huracán Iota para las provincias de Colón, Darién, Los Santos y las áreas comarcales señaladas.Informe de Etesa sobre huracán IotaEl Gabinete recibió un informe sobre la situación meteorológica en el país por los posibles efectos colaterales del huracán Iota por el territorio nacional.La Ing. Luz Calzadilla, jefa de Hidrometeorología y de la técnica Pilar López, ambas de la Empresa de Transmisión Eléctrica, S.A. (ETESA).Calzadilla detalló que a la 1: 00 a.m. Iota fue declarado por el Centro de Huracanes como un ciclón de categoría 1 con vientos de 148 kilómetros por hora, solo a seis kilómetros de pasar a categoría 2.Precisó que el huracán Iota se mantiene con un movimiento hacia al Oeste y que el día lunes podría impactar sobre las costas de Nicaragua y Honduras, con efectos colaterales sobre el territorio panameño.La técnica López señaló que el huracán puede ocasionar un aumento de lluvias en la cordillera central del país afectando a las provincias de Bocas del Toro, Chiriquí, sur de Veraguas área comarcal así como las provincia de Colón, Los Santos y Darién. Indicó que se está realizando un monitoreo constantes del caudal de los ríos en esas provincias y zonas. Destacó que Iota ocasionaría vientos de moderación baja sobre el territorio panameño de no mas de 80 kilómetros por hora y ráfagas de vientos en las zonas montañosas.

countries.society_name: The Trinidad and Tobago Red Cross Society
countries.name: Trinidad and Tobago

results.summary: On 02/11/2020, a flood started in Costa Rica, Guatemala, Honduras, Jamaica, Mexico, Nicaragua, Panama, Trinidad and Tobago, United States, lasting until 02/11/2020 (last update). The flood caused 141 deaths and 150061 displaced .

field_reports.summary: Afectaciones por inundaciones en todo el territorio nacional
field_reports.description: El sistema nacional de protección civil y su centro de operaciones de emergencias decretan alerta amarilla para la provincia de Chiriquí y comarca Ngabe Bugle, debido a las fuertes lluvias y crecidas de ríos afectando a los distritos de Baru, Bugaba, Boquete, Besiko Comarca Ngabe Bugle, Gualaca, tierras altas, esto lleva a realizar albergues temporales para las personas afectadas dando un total de 4 en tierras altas, aun se mantiene comunidades incomunicadas por el difícil acceso vía terrestre, las lluvias continúan por lo que se estima siga aumentando los daños en la región 1

field_reports.summary: Afectación indirecta por el Huracán ETA - updated 08/11/2020
field_reports.description:
La depresión tropical que se formó sobre la región central del Mar Caribe, se convirtió en la Tormenta Tropical Eta en la noche del 31 de Octubre del 2020; esta tormenta tropical se ubicó inicialmente sobre la región central del Mar Caribe a 835 km al noreste de la Ciudad de Colón aproximadamente, la cual se ha convertido en huracán. Su desplazamiento ha sido hacia el oeste y posteriormente se movió al oeste-suroeste moviéndose hacia el este de Honduras y noreste de Nicaragua.

A pesar de que el huracán no impacto directamente sobre Panamá, hemos presentado influencia indirecta de este sistema con efectos colaterales en el país ocasionando eventos de lluvias con montos elevados hacia el Occidente del País, en Chiriquí, Bocas del Toro, Comarca Ngäbe Buglé y algunos sectores de Veraguas, Coclé y se ha extendido también a la cordillera montañosa de la zona, donde nacen los caudalosos ríos del área.  En el resto del país ha predominado  los nublados, chaparrones y lluvias de variada intensidad un poco más aisladas.

Estas lluvias han provocado desbordamientos de los ríos Chiriquí Viejo, Fonseca, Jacú y Tabasará al 4 de noviembre de 2020 todos los ríos y quebradas de la provincia de Chiriquí están a su máximo nivel, provocando inundaciones, bloqueos de vías por deslizamientos de tierra, viviendas afectadas y caída de árboles.  

En el transcurso de la noche tendremos Viento del Sur produciendo incursión de abundantes nubosidades desde el pacifico panameño hacia tierra firme,  generando cielo cubierto y lluvias continuas a intermites con variadas intensidades durante las siguientes horas con desplazamiento de lluvias con intensidades desde ligera a moderadas desde el Golfo de Chiriquí a Tierra altas y Veraguas Norte.

Presentamos advertencia de continuar el incremento de los montos de lluvias, manteniendo las inundaciones en el occidente panameño. Estaciones meteorológicas satelitales de ETESA registran acumulados de lluvias extremos en las últimas 24 horas, superando en algunas regiones de Chiriquí los 300 mm de lluvias.
Las áreas que se mantienen bajo aviso por cielo cubierto con lluvias débiles a moderadas son:
·         COLON: CENTRO Y COSTA ABAJO
·         PANAMA: CHEPO, CHIMAN, SAN MIGUELITO Y PANAMA
·         PANAMA OESTE: DESDE ARRAIJAN HASTA SAN CARLOS
·         COCLE: COSTAS, CENTRO Y MONTAÑAS
·         VERAGUAS: SUR, CENTRO Y NORTE
·         CHIRIQUI: TIERRAS ALTAS Y TIERRAS BAJAS
·         COMARCA NGOBE BUGLE: CORDILLERA Y COSTAS
·         BOCAS DEL TORO: COSTAS Y CORDILLERA

Ante ello el Sistema Nacional de Protección Civil (SINAPROC) declaró en alerta amarilla a la provincia de Chiriquí, producto de las múltiples situaciones de emergencias registradas en el distrito de Tierras Altas y en los corregimientos de Cerro Punta, Paso Ancho y Volcán.

results.name: Afectación indirecta por el Huracán ETA - Reporte Inicial

field_reports.description: por desbordamientos del rio la cantera en el distrito de Arraijan, Panama Oeste se realiza la evacuacion de 7 casas con un total de 27 personas que sus hogares fueron afectados por la lluvia y deslizamientos de tierras
